author: Katherine Clarke
title: Rockefeller Estate Sells for 50% Over Its $22 Million Asking Price
text:
A Pocantico Hills, N.Y., mansion owned by the estate of David Rockefeller, the venerable chief executive of Chase Manhattan Bank, has sold for $33 million, 50% above its $22 million asking price.
Known as Hudson Pines, the Mott Schmidt-designed compound in Westchester County dates back to 1938, and had been on the market since the fall, according to representatives for the listing brokerage, Houlihan Lawrence Private Brokerage, who declined to disclose the name of the buyer.
